description: Dive into "Architectural Wonders of Pondicherry" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Architectural Wonders of Pondicherry

places.generalDescription: La Libert√© French Institute stands out as a remarkable destination for anyone eager to immerse themselves in the French language and culture. Nestled within the charming colonial architecture of Pondicherry, this institute is not just about learning; it‚Äôs an experience that fosters confidence and engagement. With dedicated teachers who thoughtfully design lessons, students find themselves enjoying a variety of activities that enhance their conversational, writing, and reading skills. The vibrant atmosphere encourages creativity while providing innovative study materials in a safe environment.

sources.snippet: The jewel in the crown of Pondicherry‚Äôs colonial architecture is undoubtedly the iconic French Institute, commonly known as Alliance Fran√ßaise. This elegant building showcases a perfect blend of Indo-French architecture. Its graceful arches, high ceilings, and lush gardens exude an air of sophistication and cultural vibrancy.
sources.shortName: Iconic facades: Marvel at the grand Facades of Pondicherry‚Äôs colonial buildings | by Krout

places.name: La Libert√© French Institute

reviews.text: I am learning French here for past 3 months through online classes. I started with zero knowledge and the improvement I made in these three months is really unbelievable. This was possible only because of right guidance and knowledge sharing from the tutor (Mr. Raj). Each and every class made me improve. The process of getting me familiar with the language was smooth and good. Initially I started learning French just on my own interest and there were no after plans. They also guide us and give ideas of what we can do productive after learning the language which is just great of them. I can say I made a good choice in selecting La Libert√© to learn French.

I have been learning French from La Liberte since a month with 0 knowledge and it has been a great experience. They have thoughtful teachers who puts a lot of thought into how they presents the material. Great at buliding confidence and keeping lessons fun and engaging through various activities that improve conversation, writing and reading skills. üéâ Kudos to the team to provide good innovative tools/study material and safe environment to their students üëç

I've been learning French at La Libert√© French Institute for the past two months, and it has been a great experience. The tutor, Sivaramakrishnan is excellent, he explains concepts clearly and ensures a strong foundation. The syllabus is well-structured, making it easier to grasp the language quickly while strengthening fundamentals.

places.address: No: 90, Azees Nagar, East Coast Rd, near IG Square, Reddiarpalayam, Puducherry, 605010, India

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Pondicherry, the Our Lady of Immaculate Conception Cathedral is a stunning example of Portuguese architectural influence. Built in the late 19th century, this magnificent church boasts striking white and yellow columns adorned with intricate carvings and Gothic arches. The vibrant stained glass windows illuminate its interior, creating a serene atmosphere that captivates visitors.

sources.shortName: French Colonial Pondicherry | PPT

places.name: Our Lady of Immaculate Conception Cathedral

reviews.text:
The Cathedral of Our Lady of the Immaculate Conception, commonly known as Samba Kovil or simply the Immaculate Conception Cathedral, is a historic Roman Catholic church in Puducherry, Tamil Nadu. Located on Mission Street in the heart of the White Town area, near Bharathi Park and about 1 km from the Puducherry Beach promenade, it's a key landmark reflecting the region's French colonial past. Built by Jesuit missionaries, its origins trace back to 1692, though the current structure was completed in 1791 after multiple reconstructions due to destruction by Dutch forces in 1693 and British occupation in 1761. It serves as the mother church of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Pondicherry and Cuddalore, established in 1770.
The cathedral showcases Portuguese architectural influences with a white-and-yellow fa√ßade, arched windows, and a prominent bell tower topped with a cross. Inside, it features a high-vaulted ceiling, ornate altars, and statues of saints, including a revered statue of Our Lady of the Immaculate Conception brought from France. The design blends European elegance with local adaptations, evident in its simple yet striking layout. A notable feature is the annual feast on December 8, marked by a car procession and vibrant celebrations, drawing devotees from across South India.
Open daily from 7:00 AM to 12:00 PM and 3:00 PM to 8:30 PM, Mass timings are 6:15 AM (Tamil) and 5:30 PM (Tamil) on weekdays, with additional Sunday services at 7:00 AM (English) and 5:30 PM (Tamil). Entry is free, though donations are appreciated. The cathedral's location makes it easily accessible-500 meters from the Puducherry Bus Stand, 2 km from the railway station, and 150 km from Chennai International Airport (3-4 hours by road). Winter (October-March) is the best time to visit for comfortable weather.
A stone's throw from Puducherry's French Quarter, this cathedral offers a serene contrast to the bustling Sacred Heart Basilica (2.5 km away). It's a must-visit for its historical depth, architectural charm, and spiritual significance in South India's Catholic heritage.

Our Lady of Immaculate Conception Cathedral in Pondicherry is such a peaceful and beautiful place. The white and gold structure looks especially stunning in the morning light. The calm atmosphere, clean surroundings, and the statue of Jesus at the entrance make it feel really special. I also appreciated the blend of French and Tamil influences it adds to the charm. Definitely worth a visit if you're exploring the area.

What a stunning spot! The Our Lady of Immaculate Conception Cathedral in Puducherry is absolutely gorgeous. Its unique blend of French, Portuguese, and Herrerian architecture is truly a sight to behold-all those beautiful white and yellow columns!‚ú®
Inside, it's incredibly peaceful. The high ceilings and intricate details create such a serene vibe. You can really feel the history here; it's a testament to Puducherry's rich past.
Seriously, if you're ever in Puducherry, you have to check it out. It's not just a beautiful building, it's a wonderfully calming experience.üòä

places.address: 204, Mission St, MG Road Area, Puducherry, 605001, India

places.generalDescription: Mahakavi Bharathiyar Memorial Centre is a museum and research center located in the former home of the renowned writer and activist, Mahakavi Subramanya Bharathiyar. The building, which was acquired by the government in 1973, showcases historical artifacts and serves as a tribute to the poet's legacy. Restored by the Pondicherry chapter of INTACH in 2014, this Grade heritage structure features a blend of French colonial and traditional Tamil-style architecture.

sources.snippet: In 1973, the building was acquired by the government to establish a museum and research center to commemorate ‚ÄúMahakavi‚Äù Subramanya Bharathiyar, at his very abode. A traditional home displaying the blend of the French colonial and Tamil styles of architecture with its elaborate wooden door and white pillars hosted the poet from 1908 to 1918. Restored by the Pondicherry chapter of INTACH in 2014, the Madras terrace roofs were renovated, cement plaster on the walls was replaced with lime mortar, existing doors and windows were rehabilitated in addition to upgraded electrical networks and a new cement floor.
sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Pondicherry for Travelling Architect

places.name: Mahakavi Bharathiyar Memorial Centre

reviews.text:
Mahakavi means Greatest Poet. I felt proud to visit the place and it is nicest feeling which gave me because I walked inside the home where the Mahakavi loved and walked around when the British was searching for his Independence activities for India.

This place is showcasing the highlights of his books, letters and his photographs. They also have a box which contains a few papers with his own handwriting.

The place is being maintained very well by the Puduchery Government.

A great and historic place where Maha Kavi Bharathiyar lived in Puducherry. Got to see the original handwriting of Maha Kavi Bharathiyar and got to know about his descendants. The staff at this museum Madam Anandhi explained the significance of this place and the history behind it. A great place to visit and a peek into our history.

places.generalDescription: The Dining Room, located within the Sri Aurobindo Ashram in Pondicherry, India, is a serene spiritual community founded by Sri Aurobindo and his disciple, The Mother. This tranquil oasis offers a peaceful environment for those seeking spiritual fulfillment through integral yoga and other practices. Pondicherry itself is a charming town with attractions like Auroville, Ousteri Wetland, and the Pondicherry Museum.

sources.shortName: Heritage buildings of Pondicherry

places.name: Dining Room (Sri Aurobindo Ashram)

reviews.text: I spent several days here, living in the ashram and enjoying the meals. It's a serene, peaceful budget friendly place, perfect for anyone looking to experience simple, homely bong tasty food that won't cause damage to your digestive system. There's sometimes a queue, and occasionally, the utensil cleaners seem a bit frustrated. Overall, a pleasant experience.

We tried the lunch here on Pongal day this year. The food was very simple - two bananas, rice, dal, bread, sabji. Nothing fancy but extremely simple and good. The cleanliness and hygiene is next level. There is good amount of seating space, even open air seating on terrace. Getting the pass to access Dining room could be tricky.

Food is served hot.Pure vegetarian. Huge sitting area.Neat and clean.
Get the coupon in the morning 8 AM for 3 time meals in the whole day.

places.address: Ranga Pillai St, White Town, Puducherry, 605001, India

places.generalDescription: The Notre Dame des Anges Church is a centuries-old building with a pink facade that is popular among tourists for its intricate statues and vaulted ceilings. The church is also known for its colorful stained glass and rich history.

sources.snippet: The Our Lady of Angels Church is one the oldest churches (completed in 1855) and a significant landmark facing the Bay of Bengal in Pondicherry, gracefully designed in the Greco-Roman style of architecture. Construction of the entire building is with brickwork and lime mortar, rising to the roof as elegant arches and vaults. Owing to egg whites and a lime mortar-based paint, it was earlier completely white, both externally and internally, thus also popularly known as White Chapel.
sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Pondicherry for Travelling Architect

sources.snippet: The walk concluded after a visit to the Notre Dame des Anges Church right on the promenade. The pink domed church with vaulted ceilings and beautiful stained-glass windows is the oldest building standing tall in the town, built in 1855.
sources.shortName: Pondicherry Heritage Festival showcases French architecture in a heritage walk led by INTACH
Pondicherry - Best Colonial Architecture to Look Out For

places.name: Notre Dame des Anges Church

reviews.text:
Notre Dame des Anges Church in Pondicherry is a stunning masterpiece of French colonial architecture and one of the most serene places to visit in the city. Located near the seaside promenade, the church is known for its pastel pink facade, which is a visual delight and perfect for photography enthusiasts. Built in 1855, its architecture is inspired by the Basilica of Lourdes in France and exudes old-world charm.

The interiors are equally mesmerizing, with high ceilings, intricate stained glass windows, and soothing pastel hues that create a peaceful and spiritual ambiance. The statues and altar are beautifully crafted, reflecting a blend of French and Indian influences.

Whether you are religious or simply love history and architecture, this church offers a sense of tranquility and timeless beauty. It's a must-visit for anyone exploring Pondicherry, not just for its spiritual significance but also for its historical and cultural relevance. Spend some time here soaking in the peace and admire the elegant details of this iconic structure.

Notre-Dame des Anges, also known as the White Chapel, is a serene and historically rich landmark in White Town, Puducherry. It holds the distinction of being the fourth oldest church in the city, originally built in 1855 in stunning Greco-Roman architectural style under the reign of Napoleon III, with architect Louis Guerre behind its design.

One of the most unique aspects of this church is its cultural inclusivity - it's the only church in Pondicherry that conducts mass in three languages: French, Tamil, and English

While exploring the charming streets of White Town, a visit to this beautiful church is a must. The architecture, influenced by French design, is captivating. The detailed and colorful ceiling and walls are a feast for the eyes, capturing your attention as soon as you enter. The church welcomes everyone, offering a tranquil space perfect for some quiet reflection. Visiting on a weekday, we found it to be peaceful and serene, allowing us to fully appreciate the beauty and calmness of the surroundings. It's a lovely spot to spend some quiet time and soak in the peaceful ambiance. Definitely worth a visit!

places.address: 3, Surcouf St, White Town, Puducherry, 605001, India

places.generalDescription: Gratitude Heritage is a charming hotel that was once a classical French Colonial family home dating back to the 19th century. The building has been carefully restored to its original state with the help of INTACH, preserving its high columns, wide arches, inner courtyard, and Madras terrace roof in authentic French style. The vintage house offers elegantly designed rooms for a comfortable stay and is located just a 3-minute walk from the promenade beach.

sources.snippet: Gratitude is a classical French Colonial family home from around the 19th century that is converted into a hospitality building. Restored closely to its original with the assistance of INTACH in 2010, its well-preserved high columns, wide arches, inner courtyard, and Madras terrace roof retain its authentic French style of architecture. Restoration and recycling of the old doors and windows were undertaken to retain original fittings wherever possible, with the rest of the shutters & hardware being identically recreated.
sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Pondicherry for Travelling Architect
Pondicherry - Best Colonial Architecture to Look Out For

places.name: Gratitude Heritage

reviews.text:
I arrived in Chennai on August 21st and took a taxi to Gratitude. The GPS was very helpful, and most taxi drivers are familiar with the location. Upon arrival, I was warmly welcomed by the lovely staff, who quickly showed me to my room. The space was pleasant and cozy, with a beautiful view.

One of my favorite things about Gratitude is its peaceful, laid-back atmosphere-it's the perfect place to relax. I highly recommend making breakfast a priority during your stay. Shanti, the chef, pours her heart into preparing delicious meals, including some really great food and fresh juice.

If you're looking for a calm, peaceful, and safe travel experience, Gratitude is an excellent choice. The place is not only hygienic and secure but also easily accessible. You're close to the ocean, the ashram, churches, museums, restaurants, and plenty of options for exploring!

You will just feel amazing! It will give you that nostalgic vibes of being at your great grandparents place. Very authentic, simple and earthy. We loved everything here - from stay to food and their cute cat. Place is very neat and clean, and top notch, they use sustainable products. A must stay.

I had a wonderful stay at Gratitude Heritage in Pondicherry. The peaceful ambiance made for a perfect getaway. The staff were incredibly attentive and friendly, ensuring every need was met. The food was excellent, with a delicious mix of local and continental dishes. Overall, a memorable experience that I would highly recommend!

The team's professionalism, timely communication, and commitment to delivering a personalized space make them truly standout. I couldn't be happier with the results ‚Äìperfectly tailored to my taste. Highly recommend their expertise to anyone out there!

places.generalDescription: Aayi Mandapam is a neoclassical monument constructed by the French in 1854 to commemorate the introduction of water into the city. It is located within a grand porch known as Mandapam, which once housed the fountain supplying water to the city.

sources.snippet: The government park located in the heart of the city in White Town, hosts several modern monuments, old sculptures, statues, stone carvings, and stately buildings. Turned into a park in the 1950s, it is an ideal blend of refined landscape and historical features. The Aayi Mandapam, a historically significant structure, constructed in 1854 is located at the center of the park.

places.name: Aayi Mandapam

reviews.text: Very quiet place. Located inside The Bharatiyar park. Very cool environment with lots of vegetation inside. Open 24 hours a day. Can come for morning or evening walk. Very nice clean environment with fresh air. Really enjoyed the area.
A big walking place and park are available. Parking is limited and maintenance of the park can be improved further.

Its one of the historical place of Puducherry and the monument building stands as a logo of Puducherry state. The place is surrounded by lush green trees and situated inside the Bharathi Park were the people can walk on the pathways around the area. Its just opposite to Lietuant Governors office cum residence.

places.address: WRMM+6MP, White Town, Puducherry, 605001, India

places.generalDescription: Raj Nivas, located in Puducherry, is a magnificent architectural marvel that showcases a fusion of French and Indian design elements. Initially the residence of the French Governor, it now serves as the official mansion for the Lieutenant Governor of Puducherry. While typically not accessible to the public, it opens its doors on select national holidays such as Indian Republic Day when it is adorned with beautiful lights.

sources.snippet: As you explore Pondicherry, you‚Äôll come across the grand Raj Nivas, the official residence of the Lieutenant Governor. This 18th-century building showcases an amalgamation of French and Indian architectural elements. With its pristine white fa√ßade, elegant colonnades, and well-manicured gardens, Raj Nivas exudes regality and charm.
sources.shortName: Iconic facades: Marvel at the grand Facades of Pondicherry‚Äôs colonial buildings | by Krout
21 buildings get heritage status in Puducherry

places.name: Raj Nivas

reviews.text:
Raj Niwas¬†(translation:¬†Government House) is the¬†official residence¬†of the¬†Lieutenant Governor of Puducherry. It is located in¬†Puducherry's capital city of¬†Pondicherry. Once it was the¬†official residence¬†of the French Governors.

Le Palais Du governor now called the Raj Niwas is situated surrounded by the Rue Jawaharlal Nehru on the North, Rue De Rangapoule on the South and Rue Saint Louis on the East and Rue Francois Martin on the West with access from the north and south. The Governor's House has a history of its own.¬†Pierre Beno√Æt Dumas, the French Governor for Pondicherry, laid the foundation for a Governor's palace in 1738 but the palace had to wait for the arrival of¬†Joseph Fran√ßois Dupleix¬†to see its completion. When¬†Jean Law de Lauriston¬†took over Pondicherry in 1765 the town was completely in ruins. Within a short span of three years a whole new town sprang up on the ruins of the old - the Governor's Palace and the administration offices on the north, the warehouses on the south, the military barracks on the east and west.
It's a beautiful building and in the heart of the town.
Beautiful building. White in colour. In the gate there is complaint boxes for suggestions and complaints. Opposite to bharthi park

places.address: 4, St Martin St, White Town, Puducherry, 605001, India

sources.snippet: Auroma Architecture led by siblings Trupti & Viral Doshi, champions a diverse team comprising skilled professionals in Architecture, Engineering, Sustainability, and Allied Services. Their vision is a world where eco-friendly spaces foster well-being and inspiration. Specialising in sustainable buildings, they craft eco-friendly homes, schools, workplaces, and luxury establishments like hotels and resorts.
sources.shortName: 3 Best Building Architects in Pondicherry

places.name: Auroma Architecture

reviews.text: An awesome place to get your dream home and office designed. They consider nature while designing. Sustainable Architecture is what they suggest you. I got my home designed where I require no lighting during day time and my ventilation designed in such a way that we don't use Air conditioner for almost 11 months in a year‚Ä¶. I strongly recommend Auroma for futuristic Eco friendly smart houses and offices.

Their property buying experience is horrible. The owner Mr. Prabodh Doshi deals in only cash. If your proceed to him with the idea of loan, he will return your token amount and keep you confused. Not at all professional experience. He expects buyers to have raw unaccounted cash being flown in to him, only then he is interested in selling you his ventures.
Apart from this his wife's hand made chocolate were amazing. One star for that.

Highly impressed with Auroma Architecture! Their designs seamlessly blend innovation and environmental consciousness, creating spaces that are both stunning and eco-friendly.  They also have an incredibly dedicated team. A go-to choice for eco-friendly architecture.

places.address: No. 245, Auro Sun City, Auroville Chinnakottakuppam road, Karuvadikuppam, Chinnakottakuppam, Tamil Nadu 605104, India

places.generalDescription: Nestled just 3.2 km from the bustling Pondicherry Bus Station, the Romain Rolland Library stands as a testament to literary heritage and history. Established in 1827, this remarkable institution is one of India's oldest libraries and holds the title of the largest library in Puducherry. Originally named Bibliotheque Publique, it was renamed in honor of the esteemed French scholar Romain Rolland during his centenary celebrations in 1966.

sources.snippet: Romain Rolland Library ‚Äì This library was established in 1872 and has a book collection of more than 3,00,000 volumes in both French and English.
sources.shortName: Heritage buildings of Pondicherry

places.name: Romain Rolland Library

reviews.text:
The library has a huge collection of books especially on Indian culture, history, philosophy, politics, etc.

You can only borrow books if your aadhaar card address is from Pondicherry. However, you can sit and read from the library.

One and only oldest library in Pondicherry. Established in 1827, this library has stood the test of time and freedom struggle, setting a mark on today's young generation. It is an elegant white building with contemporary architecture lined with the most prized books dating back several years. Nearly 177 years old, it comprises almost 335,000 books of all genres set against the timeless walls of the library. ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

Famous, main & old library in Pondy. Currently construction going on. Members can only return their books Monday to Friday   9 am to 5 pm. It will be fully functional from January 2018 but not sure. Don't miss the nice wall paintings around library Children's wing.

I spent 7 years of my life in this school from 6th till 12th. Happiest time of my life:)))) We used to have a very experience lecturers/teachers back then.
My School

places.address: WRQJ+9P3, No 37, Sri Aurobindo St, nearby Calve College School, Heritage Town, Puducherry, 605001, India

places.generalDescription: Intach Pondicherry, operated by the Indian National Trust for Art and Cultural Heritage, is dedicated to conserving India's unprotected heritage. It offers heritage walks in Pondicherry's 18th-century French Quarter, showcasing historic buildings and sharing their stories. The organization has played a significant role in restoring old Tamil and French houses, preserving their architecture and design.

sources.snippet: We have trained a lot of people who now run their own private businesses,‚Äù said Ashok Panda, co-convener of INTACH‚Äôs Puducherry chapter.
sources.shortName: Pondicherry Heritage Festival showcases French architecture in a heritage walk led by INTACH

places.name: Intach Pondicherry

reviews.text: Mr¬†Venket¬†took¬†us¬†on¬†a¬†heritage¬†tour¬†that¬†included¬†both¬†the¬†French¬†Quarter¬†and¬†the¬†Tamil¬†Quarter.¬†You¬†can¬†reserve¬†your¬†position¬†on¬†the¬†tour¬†at¬†the¬†Intach¬†office.¬†The¬†excursion¬†was¬†really¬†instructive,¬†and¬†it¬†was¬†fascinating¬†to¬†read¬†about¬†Pondicherry's¬†past¬†and¬†how¬†it¬†influenced¬†its¬†architecture.¬†There¬†is¬†the¬†opportunity¬†to¬†enter¬†some¬†buildings.¬†We¬†can¬†see¬†the¬†influence¬†of¬†French,¬†Dutch,¬†and¬†Portuguese¬†on¬†the¬†architecture,¬†as¬†well¬†as¬†an¬†interesting¬†mix¬†of¬†Tamil¬†Hindu¬†culture.¬†Our¬†tour¬†guide¬†is¬†quite¬†knowledgeable.¬†He¬†responded¬†eagerly¬†to¬†our¬†questions.Very¬†fulfilling¬†and¬†informative¬†tour¬†to¬†begin¬†exploring¬†Pondicherry.

Our experience with the tour guide, Venkata Subramanian, was truly exceptional. His insights were both informative and concise, making the tour engaging and enjoyable. We cycled through the charming French side of Pondicherry , and with  his deep knowledge of the area's history, architecture, and culture added a whole new layer of appreciation to the experience. Highly recommended for anyone looking to delve into the rich heritage of Pondicherry!

Venkat provided a lovely 2 hour walk and tour of the Tamil Quarter at a chill and leisurely pace. Highly recommend to learn about the other, non-French part of Pudicherry! Big thank you to Intach to accommodate us last minute on a holiday.

places.address: 14, La Bourdonnais St, White Town, Puducherry, 605001, India

places.generalDescription: Arikamedu Trust is an enchanting archaeological site located in Puducherry, dating back to the 1st Century BC. It offers a glimpse into the Roman era through its excavations, revealing Roman artifacts like lamps, gems, stone beads, and glassware. The site's picturesque surroundings make it a must-visit on any Pondicherry sightseeing list.

sources.snippet: Located about 7 Km south of Pondicherry on the bank of the Ariyankuppam river, the historical site served as a pivotal Indo-Roman trading city. The Archaeological Society of India now maintains the site that was once a major trading port between European countries and Rome from the 2nd century BCE to the 8th century BCE. The French Jesuit Mission building from the 18th century in extreme ruins is a French architectural wonder, despite its present state.
sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Pondicherry for Travelling Architect

places.name: Arikamedu Trust

reviews.text: If you go on a boat ride in the mangrove, you can see this place. There is nothing like it, everyone goes there for curiosity, there is nothing to do except take pictures. But it gives a very nice breeze.

Visited Arikamedu Trust during my boating trip through the mangrove forest in Pondicherry. We were given a 20-minute stop there. After a 5-minute walk from the boat, we reached the partially damaged structure. There's a small shop nearby where you can get water and some snacks. I wouldn't recommend this as a must-visit spot, but if you're interested in history and ancient culture, it might be worth a quick visit.

One of the historical places of Puducherry which is maintained by the Archeological dept. The place is surrounded by green üçè mango trees and the site is easily accessible by walk from the entrance. There are no proper name boards or parking üÖøÔ∏è facilities available near site. Few shops like tender coconut ü••, juice shop is available.
DoV: 100525.

places.address: WRQJ+33W, Vysial St, Heritage Town, Puducherry, 605001, India

places.generalDescription: Sri Manakula Vinayagar Temple, located in Pondicherry, is a revered pilgrimage site dedicated to Lord Ganesha. This ancient 15th-century temple predates the French settlement in the area and boasts a magnificent idol of Lord Ganesha. The intricately carved interiors adorned with vibrant hues make it a divine and popular attraction for both locals and tourists visiting Pondicherry.

sources.snippet: Constructed around the period when the French came to India, the temple is dated to be at least over 500 years old. Despite several efforts to destroy the temple during the French regime and the harm done during the process, the temple survives. Following the Deccan era character and traditional Dravidian style of architecture, the structure is ornated with friezes and stucco figurines all around.
sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Pondicherry for Travelling Architect

places.address: 06, Swaminatha Naicker St, Ariyankuppam, Puducherry 605007, India

places.generalDescription: In the heart of Puducherry, the Cluny Embroidery Centre is a delightful discovery housed in an 18th-century mansion. Here, skilled women meticulously craft intricate lace and embroidery on various items like bed linen, tablecloths, and handkerchiefs. The center is run by the sisters of the Cluny Convent and supports underprivileged women by providing them with training and employment opportunities.

sources.snippet: Just a few steps ahead of Dune De L‚ÄôOrient is thus 200-year-old heritage bungalow, which is run by a local convent and supports underprivileged women. The property boasts an impressive entrance with solid columns, a high roof built over teak-wood beams and chessboard-like floors. The main doorway is accentuated with two ornamental sculptures created with the bas-relief technique.
sources.shortName: Pondicherry - Best Colonial Architecture to Look Out For

places.name: Cluny Embroidery art society

reviews.text: Cluny Embroidery Society is a glimpse into the beautiful old art of hand embroidery on cloth. Elegant and graceful designs crafted by women silently, diligently, and patiently working away producing  handkerchiefs, napkins and various other products. Located in the heritage town in an old grand building, beautifully maintained, the place is a must visit to complete your visit to Pondicherry.
This embroidery art society located near white town, Dumas street. Various embroidery done cloth items displayed. Run by nuns. Those who are interested in embroidery can visit this place
An embroidery centre run by nuns. Excellent work, but expensive. Towels etc are in white cloth, hence not much practical though.

places.generalDescription: Nestled to the south of Pondicherry, Mahadev Light House is a hidden gem that often flies under the radar for many travelers. On my last day in this charming city, I stumbled upon this impressive lighthouse and was captivated by its stature and history. It‚Äôs a perfect spot to unwind while soaking in stunning coastal views. If you‚Äôre exploring Pondicherry, don‚Äôt miss out on visiting Mahadev Light House; it‚Äôs an experience that beautifully combines tranquility with scenic beauty!

sources.snippet: Raj Niwas ‚Äì The Governor of Poducherry‚Äôs residence is a 350 year‚Äôs old imposing beautiful white mansion, whose architecture is a blend of French and Tamil architecture. It was built by the French trading company that ruled puducherry in 1674 and the building was taken into procession by the French in 1769. Open to public on national holidays.

places.address: WRJP+G4W, Dumas St, White Town, Puducherry, 605001, India

places.generalDescription: Puducherry Legislative Assembly is a historic building located in Bharathi Park, opposite the Gandhi memorial. It was constructed during the French regime and now houses 30 elected MLAs and 3 nominated MLAs. The assembly is surrounded by important buildings such as Raj Niwas, Bharathi Park, and General Hospital. Members of the assembly convene here to make legislations for Puducherry under the leadership of an elected Speaker.

sources.shortName: Heritage buildings of Pondicherry

places.generalDescription: Explore the charming Puducherry Old Court Building, which is part of a fascinating tour that includes various historical and architectural landmarks. The building has been fully renovated, offering visitors a glimpse into its rich history and cultural significance. As you wander through this iconic structure, you'll also have the opportunity to discover other nearby attractions such as statues, military barracks, town hall buildings, libraries, monuments, lighthouses, and more.

sources.snippet: Constructed in 1766, the two-storey court and law school was used as H√¥tel du commandant du g√©nie, and later as the Cour d‚Äôappel until 1955. The 148-year-old load-bearing masonry structure functioned as a court until 2008. Restoration of the heritage structure was undertaken by INTACH Pondicherry, which included the demolition of weaker portions to rebuild it with its authentic style and materials.
